abstract.para: Data collected in the fall to determine effects of overwintering on grayling growth and lipid storage. Similar data are collected in the spring as the fish leave the lake.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The first headwater lake of the Kuparuk river, approximately 20 river km above the Dalton Highway

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: DATA FILE ENTERED BY: DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 7Oct91

para.literalLayout: Grayling adults and juveniles are captured as they enter the headwater lake. Some fish, including a few lake trout, are captured in the lake. Fish are measured, weighed, tagged and released. Some fish are kept to do lipid extractions on, to determine the condition of the fish as they begin the winter. All lengths are total length in cm, using the bottom lobe of the caudal fin. Fish weights are wet weight in grams, taken immediately after the fish are captured.
Notes: Lake trout are designated by tag color ending in LT and in the comments. All the rest of the fish are grayling.

Variable Variable descrip. Precis./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values SITE site of measurement y TAG# tag number n COLOR tag color n TAGDATE date fish was tagged DDMMMYY n y LENGTH length of fish .0/cm n WEIGHT weight of fish .00/g n y DATE date measurement taken DDMMMYY n D/D distance from 84 dripper .0/km n y LOCATION location if D/D is missing n y COMMENT notes about data n
